ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: This class is great if you want to dip your toes in art
I learned so much about color and contrast and really developed an ability to appreciate the daily color experience of the world.
Learned about colors and how they interacted with eachother
I learned how to see color and color relationships in a controlled environment.
I learned a lot about color and it relation to culture as well as new ways to view it.
simultaneous contrast, other ways of comparing/describing/perceiving/using/making colors

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The class itself was a lot of discussion and critiques.

We were so lucky to have Halsey teach us. I wish there had been more creative assignments, but in order to understand color relationships and color theory better, I think we had to do the academic stuff.
There was a lot of work but all of it was interesting. Maybe having more time in class to do work would have been nice. I really liked all the trips we took.
professor is very passionate, more examples of color studies would be nice

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Best art class I have taken here
Yes, it is a great learning experience
Yes! I would recommend any course Halsey teaches.
I would recommend this course, it's very unique and I really enjoyed the way it was taught. We learned some interesting color theory by just looking at different color expressions in day to day life.
yes! Halsey is amazing and everyone was so passionate, it made me want to learn and engage
